member.name: T:ABB.SASymbols.Common.Direction
member.summary: Indicates the direction of a substation automation symbol.
member.remarks: Not all enum values apply to all symbols.

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.Direction.north
member.summary: Direction is north, i.e., if there is only one connection, it will be on the top.

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.Direction.west
member.summary: Direction is west, i.e., if there is only one connection, it will be on the right.

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.Direction.south
member.summary: Direction is south, i.e., if there is only one connection, it will be on the bottom.

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.Direction.east
member.summary: Direction is east, i.e., if there is only one connection, it will be on the left.

member.name: M:ABB.SASymbols.Common.RGB.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Build an ABB.IEC61850.CoreTypes.RBG from a string.
member.param: String representation of an RGB object.
member.returns: An ABB.IEC61850.CoreTypes.RGB instance corresponding to the string.
member.exception: if the argument string does not correspond to an RGB value "rgb(rrr,ggg,bbb)".

member.name: M:ABB.SASymbols.Common.RGB.TryParse(System.String,ABB.SASymbols.Common.RGB@)
member.summary: Converts the specified string representation to its equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.
member.param: A string containing the value to convert.

When this method returns, if the conversion succeeded, contains the equivalent of . If the conversion failed, contains null. The conversion fails if value is null or is not equivalent to a string representation of a . This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if value was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode
member.summary: Enumeration of SA symbols for display.
member.remarks: Rationale: if SCL proposes a code for the equipment, use that same code if possible.

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode.DIS
member.summary: Disconnector or earthing switch (also SCL Equipment code).

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode.REA
member.summary: Reactor (also SCL Equipment code), which has only one connection point.

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode.PSH
member.summary: Power Shunt (also SCL Equipment code). It is a resistor.

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode.PTW1_PTR2
member.summary: Primary Transformer Winding (for a 2-winding Power Transformer), without Tap Changer.
member.remarks: PTW is the SCL code for Transformer Winding, and PTR the one for Power Transformer

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode.PTW2_PTR2
member.summary: Secondary Transformer Winding (for a 2-winding Power Transformer), without Tap Changer.
member.remarks: PTW is the SCL code for Transformer Winding, and PTR the one for Power Transformer

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode.PTW1_PTR3
member.summary: Primary Transformer Winding (for a 3-winding Power Transformer), without Tap Changer.
member.remarks: PTW is the SCL code for Transformer Winding, and PTR the one for Power Transformer

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode.PTW2_PTR3
member.summary: Secondary Transformer Winding (for a 3-winding Power Transformer), without Tap Changer.
member.remarks: PTW is the SCL code for Transformer Winding, and PTR the one for Power Transformer

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode.PTW3_PTR3
member.summary: Tertiary Transformer Winding (for a 3-winding Power Transformer), without Tap Changer.
member.remarks: PTW is the SCL code for Transformer Winding, and PTR the one for Power Transformer

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode.LTC1_PTR2

member.remarks: LTC is the SCL code for Load Tap Changer, and PTR the one for Power Transformer.

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode.LTC2_PTR2
member.summary: Tap Changer for the Secondary Transformer Winding (for a 2-winding Power Transformer).
member.remarks: LTC is the SCL code for Load Tap Changer, and PTR the one for Power Transformer.

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode.LTC1_PTR3
member.summary: Tap Changer for the Primary Transformer Winding (for a 3-winding Power Transformer).
member.remarks: LTC is the SCL code for Load Tap Changer, and PTR the one for Power Transformer.

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode.LTC2_PTR3
member.summary: Tap Changer for the Secondary Transformer Winding (for a 3-winding Power Transformer).
member.remarks: LTC is the SCL code for Load Tap Changer, and PTR the one for Power Transformer.

member.remarks: LTC is the SCL code for Load Tap Changer, and PTR the one for Power Transformer.

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode.PTR2
member.remarks: PTR is the SCL code for Power Transformer.

member.name: F:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SASymbolCode.PTR3
member.remarks: PTR is the SCL code for Power Transformer.

member.name: T:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SwitchIndicatorState
member.remarks:
Part 7-4 (p. 78), on data attribute Loc:
This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch. The physical key or toggle switch may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read. This Data indicates the switchover between local and remote operation; local = TRUE, remote = FALSE. At bay level local means operation from the bay unit and remote means opereation from a station unit. At process level, local means operation direct on the process device, for example on a circuit breaker and remote means operation from a bay unit. If in a Logical Device the Loc of LLN0 is in contradiction to the Loc of any contained LN, "local" is always dominant.

member.name: T:ABB.SASymbols.Common.SwitchPosition
member.summary: Switch position, as defined in the IEC 61850 standard, with the additional state "earthed".
